title: Dow Down More Than 200 Points on Microsoft, Tech Slump
text: LIVE UPDATES | CONCLUDED Last Updated: March 15, 2024 at 7:03 PM EDT Updated 14 days ago By Karishma Vanjani Stocks saw further pressure by noon on Friday, as technology shares sold off ahead of Next week's Federal Reserve meeting. The Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 225 points or 0.6%. Top laggards include Microsoft’s stock, down 2.6%; it’s the second highest weighted component in the 30-component index. Salesforce, Amazon and Cisco Systems followed, logging losses of 2.6%, 2.5% and 1.3%. The S&P 500 was down 0.8%, trimming its year-to-date gain to 8%. The tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite lost 1.1%.
